latex: Fix a positive real number $c>1$ and positive integer $n$.  Initially, a blackboard contains the numbers $1,c,\ldots, c^{n-1}$.  Every minute, Bob chooses two numbers $a,b$ on the board and replaces them with $ca+c^2b$.  Prove that after $n-1$ minutes, the blackboard contains a single number no less than \[\left(\dfrac{c^{n/L}-1}{c^{1/L}-1}\right)^L,\] where $\phi=\tfrac{1+\sqrt 5}2$ and $L=1+\log_\phi(c)$.
